title: How to Remove a Stamp from Its Envelope

steps.headline: Decide to remove or keep the stamp on the paper.
steps.description: Some stamps are more valuable if they are kept on the envelope. An old stamp may be worth a few dollars by itself, but may be worth many times that in the historical context of the envelope that bears it.

steps.headline: Cut stamps off the corner of the envelope with some scissors.
Place the cut corner in bowl of warm water and wait 10+ minutes.
steps.description: Apply cold water if you are worried the ink might run. In the past, some stamps were manufactured so soaking would ruin the stamp; this prevented people from illegally reusing them on new mail.

steps.headline: Most of the stamps will float off, so put them on the blotter of paper towels face down.
steps.description: Do this carefully so the stamps do not tear or crease. Some stamps require coaxing to come off the paper, especially the newer "peel and stick" versions.

steps.headline: Put the cookie sheet of stamps in a dry place (such as the unheated oven) overnight.
Place the now dry (and maybe a bit curled) stamps flat between the pages of a large book and weight them down if necessary.
Leave them for 3 weeks to be flat for handling and sorting into your collection, or for later use.
Empty envelope.
steps.description: Remove the contents of the envelope.

steps.headline: Place in microwave.
steps.description:
This is only to melt the adhesive from the stamp.>1000 watt- Microwave for around 10 seconds
700-950 watt- Microwave for around 15-20 seconds

steps.headline: Peel.
steps.description: Peel off the stamp from the envelope. If it does not come off easily, repeat step 2.

steps.headline: Tape or glue.
steps.description: The adhesive from the stamp is no longer effective. It will require you to use tape or glue to keep stamp on new envelope.

steps.headline: Insert your nails.
steps.description: Place your nails under the stamp. Use 2 fingers. Use your nails to pull up the stamp a little.

steps.headline: Pull.
steps.description: Use your finger to pull the stamp up. Pull slowly and carefully. You can rip the stamp or envelope if you do not pull carefully.

steps.headline: Tape or glue.
steps.description: By peeling a small amount of paper from the envelope can stick to the adhesive.
